intro: Centaurium africanum, commonly known as the African centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Centaurium africanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
